backend

Class AvgHaemoglobinLevel

  • java.lang.Object
    • databaseConnectors.DatabaseManager
      • backend.AvgHaemoglobinLevel

  • public class AvgHaemoglobinLevel
extends DatabaseManager
    Database/calculation class for the AvgGlobinLevelChart. Supplies the required data from the database with different methods like getAverageLevels() and getAllMonths() Created by Toni on 28.04.2017.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AvgHaemoglobinLevel() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private java.lang.String checkGender(java.lang.String input)
      Method checks if gender is valid.
      java.util.List<java.util.Date> getAllMonths(java.lang.String gender)
      Returns a list of java.util.Dates formated like YYYY-MM-15 The reason it returns it with a fixed date to the 15th of each month is because it is only used in the AvgGlobinLevelChart and we have decided that the average reading of a month should be displayed on the 15th of that month.
      double getAverageLevel(java.lang.String gender, java.util.Date dateInput)
      Gets the average Haemoglobin level for a certain gender and month.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getAverageLevels(java.lang.String gender)
      Gets all the months with data for the specified gender, and gets the average Haemoglobin level for that month.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AvgHaemoglobinLevel

        public AvgHaemoglobinLevel()

    • Method Detail

      • checkGender

        private java.lang.String checkGender(java.lang.String input)
        Method checks if gender is valid. If it is written wrong it returns the way it is written in the database. Also lets you use "m" and "f" in stead of having to type "male" and "female".
        Parameters:
        input - The string that will be checked.
        Returns:
        The processed and correctly written name of the gender (sex really in our case). "Invalid" if the input is wrong.

      • getAverageLevels

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getAverageLevels(java.lang.String gender)
                                                  throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets all the months with data for the specified gender, and gets the average Haemoglobin level for that month. This is then added to a List of Doubles to be used by the charting class.
        Parameters:
        gender -
        Returns:
        Average haemoglobin levels. Index of the readings corresponds to the months returned by the getAllMonths method.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        getAllMonths(String)

      • getAverageLevel

        public double getAverageLevel(java.lang.String gender,
                              java.util.Date dateInput)
        Gets the average Haemoglobin level for a certain gender and month. Calls checkGender. Then converts the inputted java.util.Date object to a java.sql.Date. Creates a startDate and endDate for the month using lengthOfMonth() and minusDays(14) and plusDays(); Queries the database for the average reading then returns it.
        Parameters:
        gender - takes paramaters m,f,Male/male,Female/female
        dateInput - Must be given like: YYYY-MM-15
        Returns:
        Average haemoglobin level for that month and gender. -1 if gender input is wrong. -2 if SQL error.

      • getAllMonths

        public java.util.List<java.util.Date> getAllMonths(java.lang.String gender)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                   java.sql.SQLException
        Returns a list of java.util.Dates formated like YYYY-MM-15 The reason it returns it with a fixed date to the 15th of each month is because it is only used in the AvgGlobinLevelChart and we have decided that the average reading of a month should be displayed on the 15th of that month. Class queries the database and returns the result.
        Parameters:
        gender - Takes: m,f,Male,Female (upper and lowercase)
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.sql.SQLException
